title: Graph of Polar Function - Restricted Domain

content.description:
The portion of the graph shown is half of a loop. The loop has a horizontal orientation to the left of the origin, the center of the polar grid.

The half of a loop begins at the origin and moves downward and to the left, passing the radius of 1, to a maximum distance from the polar axis.

From the maximum distance from the polar axis, the half of a loop moves upward and to the left, until it reaches the radius of 2.

A portion of the graph of the polar function <math alttext="r equals f open parentheses theta close parentheses"><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced></math>, where <math alttext="f open parentheses theta close parentheses equals 2 minus 4 cos theta"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>cos</mi><mpadded lspace="+1px"><mi>θ</mi></mpadded></math>, is shown in the polar coordinate system for <math alttext="a less or equal than theta less or equal than b"> <mi>a</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>θ</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>b</mi> </math>.
content.question: If <math alttext="0 less or equal than a less than b less than 2 pi"><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>a</mi><mo><</mo><mi>b</mi><mo><</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></math>, which of the following are the values for <math alttext="a"><mi>a</mi></math> and <math alttext="b"> <mi>b</mi> </math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="a equals 0"><mi>a</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> and <math alttext="b equals pi over 3"><mi>b</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>3</mn></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="a equals 0"><mi>a</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> and <math alttext="b equals pi over 6"><mi>b</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>6</mn></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="a equals pi"><mi>a</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>π</mi></math> and <math alttext="b equals fraction numerator 4 pi over denominator 3 end fraction"><mi>b</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>3</mn></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="a equals pi"><mi>a</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>π</mi></math> and <math alttext="b equals fraction numerator 7 pi over denominator 6 end fraction"><mi>b</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>7</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>6</mn></mfrac></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="a equals 0"><mi>a</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> and <math alttext="b equals pi over 3"><mi>b</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>3</mn></mfrac></math>

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Identify information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations to answer a question or construct a model, with and without technology.
